problem_text:
A generalized quadrangle GQ(s, t) with parameters s, t is by definition an incidence system consisting of points and lines in which every line consists of s + 1 points, every two different lines have at most one common point, each point belongs to t + 1 lines, and for any point a not lying on a line L there is a unique line containing a and intersecting L.
a) Does GQ(4, 11) exist?
b) Can the automorphism group of a hypothetical GQ(5, 7) contain involutions?
A. A. Makhnëv
